intro: Jacquemontia havanensis, commonly known as the Cuban moonflower, is a flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, white, night-blooming flowers. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
